snippet: Mr. Caesar was a force of nature who starred on “Your Show of Shows” in the early 1950s and influenced generations of comedians and comedy writers.
abstract: Sid Caesar, comedic force of nature who became one of television's first stars in the early 1950s and influenced generations of comedians and comedy writers, dies at age 91; Caesar's 90-minute comedy-variety extravaganza Your Show of Shows, beloved by millions of Americans, altered landscape of television comedy, transitioning it from jokes and pratfalls to characters and situations, leaving an indelible mark on American comedy.

byline.original: By MERVYN ROTHSTEIN and PETER KEEPNEWS

lead_paragraph: Mr. Caesar was a force of nature who starred on “Your Show of Shows” in the early 1950s and influenced generations of comedians and comedy writers.

headline.main: Sid Caesar, Comedian of Comedians From TV’s Early Days, Dies at 91
headline.print_headline: Sid Caesar, Comedian of Comedians on Early TV, Dies at 91
